titleStmt.title: William Ellison to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5785

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your Petitionir William Ellison respictfully states that at the present August Term of the Whitly Circuit Court 1864 he was fined $20. upon an Indictment for a violation of an Act entitled, "an act to amend Chapter 99 of the Revised Statutes, title "Taverns Tipling Houses &" approved Feby 21 1863. He states that James Cultrich his partner had a license to keep a Tavern, and your petitioner was employed about the taven in vending vintuous liquors, with out taking the oath, required by the act afsd, not knowing that the law required him to do so, & not knowing of the existence of the law, as the laws had not been distributed to whitly County at the time refered to in the Indictmnt -- It was a sacrifice On him to do a thing that he did not know he ought to do, he says that no possible injury has resulted from the he prays that the fine be remitt
Sworn to before day of august 1864 by Wiliam Ellison

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
Wm Ellison
$20 --
Remit
8th Sept /

Williamsburg
Aug 29th
Govr Bramlet
Dear Sir
I hope that you remit this fine

your friend
Granville Pearl
H F Finley
